intro: Dactylanthes patula, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by fluffy seeds dispersed by the wind. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as succulent leaves and deep root systems. Dactylanthes patula is often found in sandy soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
